subject: Automobile Racing
organizations: National Assn of Stock Car Auto Racing
lead_paragraph: Dale Earnhardt Jr. and Casey Mears were penalized for intentionally bumping cars after a race Saturday at Phoenix International Raceway. Nascar put the two on probation for six races; neither was fined or lost points. Contact between the two caused Earnhardt to crash with 11 laps to go in the race. He led for 63 laps and appeared headed for a top-10 finish, but the accident dropped him to 31st. After the race, Earnhardt spun Mears on the cool-down lap. Mears retaliated by passing several cars on pit road to find Earnhardt, then bumping into the back of his car.
